Articles.Content:
Everyone knows that kerbal space program, just like all other games, has unused content. Right? But what if i tell you, that after some internet digging ive found this. Unimplemented Content - Kerbal Space Program Wiki ''whats this'' its 20+ unused celestial bodies for the stock game, and some interesting changes to planets like eve, and even binary gas giants!

stuff like super kerbins and 3 whole new gas giants, one of em with rings! Im going to list all the celestial bodies and then the major changes of current planets. these are copied n pasted from the link above. (i wont include the orbital paths, mass, gforce, radius n stuff like that)

Xubol

A near-molten ball of salt and sand, Xubol was to be the first planet of the Kerbol System.[1

 

Faz and Jall

Planned moons of Eve.

Rupa

Rupa, a planned moon of Kerbin with a 60km radius and 30,500km semimajor axis, was revised to become Minmus.

Meander

A brilliant green gas planet, worshiped in years past as the god which created Kerbal-kind. Revised to become Jool. It also has several moons: Haqua, egar (that ended up being duna)  lumowan and 20+ unspecified minor moons

Toshakona Belt

A ring of debris large and small stretching from just outside Meander's orbit to just inside that of Juniper.

Sothebin

Upon discovery it was touted as a 'Second Kerbin' - but that frenzy died down quickly after discover that the dark patches on its surface were dried basaltic lava, not oceans.

Juni

The largest of the planets, Juni was also to boast the largest ring system and most moons.

 moons: gax, tiberius, Junimu: The largest known moon, and the only one with a ring system of its own, composed mostly of material stolen from the main rings of Juni

 

Mandrake & Rutherford

Mandrake and Rutherford were to be two brilliant blue gas planets orbiting one another, named for their siamese twin discoverer(s), Mandrake & Rutherford Kerman. How they formed is unknown, as is how long this configuration will last. (no specified moons sadly ): )

Harvest

A reddish-brown miniplanet sharing Kerbin's orbit, occupying its L4 Lagrange Point.

Ralph

An icy body, situated between Meander and Juniper. it has 1 moon called ralph jr

Gas planet 2

~50% larger than Jool, with rings, it has 4 moons, plus some unspecified tiny moons:  eoloo, daphy, potatus and fonso.

Mez

Super-Kerbin with rapid rotation period, somewhat lens-shaped as a result.

Miscellaneous

belt of vulcanic asteroids

now the changes to current stock planets

 

EVE

less inclination to the orbit. it is now less pink and much darker on the surface, due to the presence of clouds. you need lights to see unless there is a thunderstorm

DUNA

i wouldnt include this because this is supposed to be egar, but duna has a new moon beyond ike's orbit, it would be cool to have a moonmoon tho

JOOL

its the smallest gas giant according to the wiki, it is not green but has green bands. its 150 % the current jool, with the moon's sizes changing as well (jool has the biggest moons of the system)

LAYTHE

its a vulcanic moon, it has no ice caps and has a faint gas torus escaping the atmosphere, its mostly covered by clouds its the size of duna

VALL

it replaces eoloo and its mun sized

please make this, it sounds cool as hell, maybe even an extra pack to the stock system like outer planets mod, or a planet pack of its own. but i swear, if anyone makes this, and it releases on ckan, im gona play it istantly.

Edited July 13, 2023 by raptorguy100

I REMIND ALL THAT ALL THE ORBITAL DETAILS AND SIZE OF THE PLANETS ARE ON THE WIKI

Edited July 12, 2023 by raptorguy100
This does seem interesting, maybe this could be like an early kerbol system sorta planet pack. Like Harvest could be the reason the Mun exists kinda like Theia IRL?  Juni seems cool too.
Interesting concept. Title is a little clickbaity though.
Ur prob right, the title is clicbaity. Ima change it, but still, this is in my opinion a great concept.

mandrake+rutherford already exists, orbiting a custom planetary system called Gememma in Whirligig world. you might want to check that out

overall most of the stuff try to make the system more realistic and more like GPP (realism wise), it’s a shame these things never made it
